newsitem.title: USA: Parametric Technology to join S&P 500.
newsitem.headline: Parametric Technology to join S&P 500.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Tuesday that it will replace Pacific Telesis Group in the S&P 500 Index with Parametric Technology Corp after the close of trading April 2.
Pacific Telesis Group has been acquired by component SBC Communications Inc in a friendly stock merger that closed Tuesday.
Parametric Technology will be replaced in the S&P MidCap 400 Index by Union Planters Corp, Standard & Poor's said.
Tel-Save Holdings Inc, a telecommunications services firm, will replace Union Planters, a bank holding company, in the S&P SmallCap 600 Index, Standard & Poor's said.

Parametric Technology is a leading developer and marketer of fully integrated software products used to automate the design-through-manufacturing process for the mechanical computer-aided design, manufacturing, and engineering industries.
